entry.title: BIs with incorrect country code metadata resulting in incorrect invoice for December 2022 month end
entry.summary: Feb 7, 06:16 PST Resolved - On January 4th, during a planned BI update to resolve detected configuration issues, 835 BIs were misconfigured. The Month End for December usage was run on January 5th, during which metadata which had been changed during this configuration event was used to produce invoices for 89,097 accounts. The misconfiguration led to invoices assigning BIs to incorrect countries. This led to 5 customer contacts, with some customers delaying paying their invoices pending an updated invoice. The issue was escalated to engineering on January 25th as a single customer incident. Further triage identified the breadth of the problem and causes by February 2nd. The issue was resolved when revised invoices were sent to 5497 Invoiced customers and 6,357 PAYG customers that are configured to have invoices emailed to them on February 6th.

entry.title: Incident: Errors running workflows
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On January 31, 2023 from 11:40 AM PST to 11:55 AM PST, customers may have experienced issues with workflows not running as expected or posting duplicate messages.
A network event prevented access to some of the database servers that support workflows. This disruption meant that the remaining servers were unable to handle the workflow load.
We restarted the affected servers and manually increased the capacity to resolve the issue, restoring normal workflow behaviour.

entry.title: Incident: Users unable to enter team name when creating a workspace
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On January 31, 2023 from 9:44 AM to 3:17 PM PST, some customers may have experienced issues creating new workspaces.
An error in our onboarding flow meant we were incorrectly assuming new workspaces had completed the onboarding process before any onboarding actually took place, leaving these newly created workspaces in an unusable limbo state. We reverted the change that caused the initial onboarding inconsistencies, then released a fix to resolve some dependencies from the reverted file.
Everyone should be able to create new workspaces as normal once again, although you may experience some overzealous onboarding prompts as the system resolves any lingering inconsistencies.

entry.title: Incident: Threads, direct messages, and channels are currently not loading
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On January 24, 2023, from 5:50 AM to 9:30 AM PST, some customers experienced errors when opening threads and saw blank channels and direct message histories.
We traced this issue to an unexpected spike in a database load. We made a configuration change that restored full functionality to threads and conversations for all impacted users.
We are investigating ways to prevent this from occurring in the future.
You may need to reload Slack (Command/Ctrl + Shift + R) in order for the fix to be reflected on your end. We're sorry for the disruption we brought to your day.

entry.title: Incident: Some customers may be encountering an error code when opening a workflow in a new window
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From January 23, 2023 at 3:00 PM PST to January 24, 2023 at 7:02 AM PST some customers encountered an error when opening a workflow in a new window.
We determined this issue was caused by a recent change to how Slack handles additional windows. This change was reverted and the issue was corrected.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues with workflows
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On January 23, 2023 from 12:41 PM to 1:15 PM PST, some customers may have experienced issues executing workflows.
A planned upgrade to part of our infrastructure caused an unexpected spike in database load. Our load-balancing system kicked in automatically, restoring normal workflow functionality.

entry.title: Incident: A small percentage of users may see a delayed response when loading channels and threads
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On January 23, 2023 from around 12:41 PM to 1:15 PM PST, some customers may have experienced delays when opening channels and threads.
We made a scheduled improvement to part of our infrastructure which inadvertently caused an increase in database load. Our automated recovery system intervened, balancing the load and resolving the issue for all affected customers.

entry.title: TS-2023-002
entry.summary: Description: An issue in the Tailscale coordination server allowed nodes with expired node keys to continue communicating with other nodes in a tailnet. What happened? There was a flaw in Tailscale’s logic for expiring node keys. If the set of nodes that can connect in a tailnet (the netmap) didn’t have any changes, then expired node keys were not immediately removed from the netmap. The longest delay in removal was 19 days, from 2022-12-20 to 2023-01-09. Who is affected? All tailnets with nodes whose node keys expired prior to 2023-01-12 may have been affected. Admins of a tailnet can view nodes with expired node keys in the admin console. What is the impact? Connections between nodes could continue after a node key expired, both when the expired node key was the source or when it was the destination of a connection. Connections to nodes with expired node keys would only be possible if they met all of the following criteria: The peer node was in the same tailnet as, or shared into a tailnet with the node with the expired node key; The peer node and the node with the expired node key were allowed to connect based on the access rules in the tailnet policy file at the time of expiry of the node key; The tailnet’s netmap, including access rules, nodes added or removed from the tailnet, or connectivity of nodes in the tailnet did not change since the node key expiry; and Tailscale had not deployed a change to the coordination server since the node key expiry. What do I need to do? No action is required. Tailscale has deployed a fix to the coordination server as of 2023-01-11. Upgrade clients to v1.36 or later for an additional mitigation. In conjunction with the coordination server fix, this mitigation prevents nodes from connecting to nodes with expired node keys if the Tailscale coordination server is offline or unreachable. Credits We would like to thank Derek Ellis and Alex Eiser for reporting this issue.

entry.title: List your properties on maeva.com and get more bookings !
entry.summary:
Partners
We are today happy to announce our new partnership with a big French company : maeva ! We have been working closely to the maeva team to offer a new direct integration to our Smily clients. Therefore, you can easily push your properties to the maeva websites and promote your listings to millions of French guests using this channel !
About maeva.com maeva.com is a tour operator specialized in vacation rentals which promotes properties in leisure and tourist areas. Acquired by the Pierre et Vacances group in 2001, maeva.com is now appreciated by French travelers for its general vacation rental site presenting more than 50,000 properties and having hosted more than 200,000 travelers in the summer of 2022. entry.title: TS-2023-001
entry.summary: Description: An issue in the Tailscale coordination server allowed a malicious individual to share nodes from other tailnets to themselves, if they knew the node ID of the target. What happened? A bug in Tailscale’s node sharing logic allowed the creation of sharing invitations by unauthorized users. A malicious individual who knew a target node’s database ID could generate and accept a sharing invite for that node without being an admin of the target node’s tailnet. This was possible for any node in any tailnet, as long as the individual knew the target’s node ID. The node ID is an integer used in the admin panel’s database, and is not related to the node “StableID” that is visible to Tailscale clients. A node’s ID is only visible in the API or admin console, by admins of either the node’s tailnet or a tailnet to which that node has already been shared. IDs are random 64-bit numbers that are not sequential or otherwise easily guessable. The bug was introduced on 2022-09-14, reported to us on 2023-01-11, and remediated on 2023-01-12. Who is affected? All tailnets with nodes are affected. What is the impact? This vulnerability was not triggered or exploited. Analysis of tailnet logs shows that no unauthorized shares were created or accepted while the vulnerability was present, except as part of the proof of concept from the individual who reported the vulnerability. Admins of a tailnet can review nodes that are shared out of their tailnet in the admin console. Sharing invites are logged as events in configuration audit logs. Admins can also review invites created and accepted in their configuration audit logs in the admin console. What do I need to do? No action is required. Tailscale has deployed a fix to the coordination server as of 2023-01-12, and verified that the vulnerability was not exploited. Credits We would like to thank Benjamin Roberts (tsujamin) for reporting this issue.

entry.title: Servers down
entry.summary: Jan 16, 09:00 PST Resolved - Notion was down between 8:56 - 9:12 AM PT. Service is now recovered.

entry.title: Incident with Actions
entry.summary: Jan 16, 16:43 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jan 16, 16:31 UTC Update - We found an issue that caused high database replication lag, leading to issues visible in multiple services. We have resolved this issue and are expecting services to become healthy once queues drain. Jan 16, 15:51 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Actions.

entry.title: Incident: Some customers may be unable to complete SSO configuration
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From January 6th at 8:42 AM PST to January 15th at 10:00 PM PST, some users were running into issues when completing their SSO configuration. In the SSO settings the "Test Configuration" button led to an error message page.
We identified a recent code change as the cause of the issue and a fix was launched to correct it.

entry.title: Incident with Codespaces
entry.summary: Jan 14, 16:58 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jan 14, 16:09 UTC Update - We are investigating issues with Codespaces port forwarding. Users may be able to use the desktop client as a workaround. Jan 14, 15:13 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Codespaces.

entry.title: Incident with Copilot
entry.summary: Jan 12, 04:55 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jan 12, 04:51 UTC Update - Some Copilot plans were impacted by a recent backend change causing those users to see an error that access has ended. We have applied a change to correct this and are seeing full recovery. Jan 12, 03:59 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Copilot.

entry.title: Make intermittent login issues
entry.summary: Jan 11, 17:36 CET Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jan 11, 12:00 CET Monitoring - The root cause of the issue has been identified and a remedy is already in place . Some users might have experienced troubles with logging in to the platform whilst we can confirm that there was no impact on running scenarios . We are actively monitoring the situation . Jan 11, 11:37 CET Investigating - We are currently experiencing intermittent issues when logging in to make zones . We are actively investigating the issue and working on a solution.

entry.title: Incident with Actions and Git Operations
entry.summary: Jan 10, 18:14 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jan 10, 17:54 UTC Update - Some action hosted runners are experiencing longer than normal run times. Jan 10, 17:22 UTC Update - Actions is experiencing degraded performance. We are still investigating and will provide an update when we have one. Jan 10, 17:04 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Git Operations.

entry.title: 500 Errors Across Multiple Endpoints
entry.summary: Jan 9, 15:10 PST Resolved - From 14:00-15:00 Pacific Time (PT), we saw increased 500 errors for multiple API endpoints, including reservations, listings and threads. The issue is now identified and resolved, please retry any failed requests during this time. Apologies for the inconvenience caused due to this incident and thank you for your patience and understanding.
